thread.title: The Phillips Curve Isn’t a Good Monetary Tool

author: wsjcom
title: The Phillips Curve Isn’t a Good Monetary Tool
text: I agree with Neel Kashkari about “How the Unfettered Fed Flattened the Phillips Curve” (op-ed, May 22). Formal unemployment has become a poor measure of full employment. High levels of underemployment (e.g., part-time work), as well as declines in the participation rate, have meant that even when measured unemployment is low, there is still an elastic supply of labor which can come from shifting from part-time to full-time work or from increases in the participation rate. Full employment in the U.S. used to be defined as about 3.5% unemployment. But if underemployment is around 20% and the participation rate below 61%,...
